ai.desc: Begins with a move pool of every move except Furioso. Can use any move in the move pool with equal probability, but once a move is used, it is removed from the move pool. Once the move pool is empty, will use Furioso and then reset the move pool. Durandal and Zelkova Workshop cannot be used right before Furioso.
ai.notes: Many of this creature's moves have additional effects depending on if it is currently the player's turn or the enemy's turn. Its second intent is a preview of its next move, which can be useful for planning ahead.

ai.desc: Begins with either Charge or Clean, then alternates between the two moves. In the 2 Helpers Act 1 elite encounter, the right Helper will always start with Charge, and the left Helper will always start with Clean.
ai.notes: Be careful about letting this enemy trigger Pattern Recognition after it uses Charge - the debuff cleanse will turn its Temp Strength into permanent Strength!

ai.desc: Uses Spring's Genesis every 3 turns. Otherwise, has equal chances of using Full Bloom or Magnificent End, but cannot use either move twice in a row.
ai.notes: The first Attack you play each turn will deal full damage for the rest of the combat, but all other Attacks are weakened. Make sure to play your strongest Attacks first each turn!

Begins with either Trembling Motion or Shaking Blow on the first turn, then always uses Shaking Blow from then on. In the 2 Crazed Employees Act 1 normal encounter, both will use Trembling Motion first. In the 3 Crazed Employees Act 1 normal encounter, the first two will use Trembling Motion first, and the last one will use Shaking Blow first. The first one's debuff will apply Weak, and the second one's debuff will apply Frail.

Cycles The First Movement -> The Second Movement -> The Third Movement -> The Fourth Movement -> Finale -> Curtain Call.
ai.notes: This boss supplies you with a lot of additional card draw - cards that gain energy, cards that combo with other cards, and low-cost cards are all more effective here. In addition, you can play the Performer Status cards the boss gives you to avoid their negative end-of-turn effects.

Has equal chances of rolling any move, but cannot roll the same move twice in a row.
ai.notes: It can be helpful to end the turn with the Expression power at 2 of 3 cards played. That way, playing 1 card next turn will change the intent, then you can play 2 more cards to react to the new intent and set up this tactic for the turn after that as well.

On the first intent, will use Ruthless Bullets every 3 turns. On other turns, has equal chances of using Inevitable Bullet or Silent Scope, but cannot use Silent Scope twice in a row. For the 2nd intent, will use Death Mark the turn before using Ruthless Bullets. Otherwise, uses Magic Bullet. The first intent will always target you, and the 2nd intent will target Nothing There unless it's dead, in which case it will target you as well. When the Seventh Bullet power has triggered for the turn or if the power is at 6/7 Attacks played, this creature will display Divinity particles.
ai.notes: Be careful about when you trigger the Seventh Bullet power - it will essentially double the amount of unblocked damage this creature deals for the turn. Triggering the power on the Mass Attack turn will result in a massive amount of damage done to Nothing There, but it can also do a lot of damage to you as well if you can't adequately block the Mass Attack. A lower risk but lower reward play would be to trigger the power when this creature is only attacking Nothing There with its second intent.

ai.desc: On the first intent, uses Dense Flesh first then alternates with Eye Contact. On the 2nd intent, uses Reaching Hand first then alternates with Evolve. The first intent will always target you, and the second intent will target Der Freischutz unless he's dead, in which case it will also target you.
ai.notes: You can manipulate this creature's Mimicry power to your advantage - play weak Attacks on this creature when it's attacking you to take less damage, and play strong Attacks on it when it's attacking the other enemy to make the other enemy take more damage!

ai.desc: Above 50% HP, will use Queen's Decree if both minions are dead. Otherwise, uses Predation. Once it drops to or below 50% HP, will use Ravenousness then use Predation every turn.
ai.notes: Bringing the minions to low HP without killing them so this creature consumes them can be a good way of maintaining Weak and Vulnerable debuffs on the boss.

If less than 3 Brothers have died, cycles Nauseating Reality -> Writhe -> Well-worn Parasol. If 3 or more Brothers have died, instead alternates between Shriek of Broken Dreams and Writhe.
ai.notes: Enraging the boss too early is generally a bad idea - take note of each Brother's passive and burst down the 2 Brothers that are most detrimental to you early on, then finish off the rest once you are ready to quickly end the fight.

ai.desc: Can use Claw, Bite or Hunt with equal chances, but cannot use any move twice in a row. After Hunter in the Dark has triggered, will only use Hunt from then onwards.
ai.notes: The Wolf becomes stronger after Hunter in the Dark triggers, so it may be worthwhile to hold back on damage to keep it above 50% HP in order to set up a stronger burst damage turn later.

ai.desc: Cycles Edacity -> Fixation -> Road of the King.
ai.notes: To avoid taking a large amount of damage from Road of the King, it's a good idea to lower the HP of the Brilliant Bliss and then finish them off on the turn Road of the King is being used.

ai.desc: Uses Tear Heart every turn.
ai.notes: Fully blocking the Sword is the most valuable way to kill it, but its constant Strength scaling from the Knight of Despair means trying to fully block it gets harder and riskier the longer it lives. If you are unable to fully block it early on, it may be better to switch plans to killing it with damage instead.

ai.desc: While the Home is alive, will use Let's Go Together! on 3 intents targeting the Home. If the Home is destroyed, will use Homing Instinct on 1 intent targeting you.
ai.notes: If your deck has sufficient frontloaded damage, you can try to burst down Scaredy Cat before the Road Home destroys the Home, and after the cat is gone you can freely attack the Road Home and cancel her intents without repercussions.

ai.desc: Begins with RAWR, then alternates between RAWR and Growl. If the Road Home is dead, will transform and intend to flee.

Uses Rage every turn. Targets the Hermit's Staff if it's alive, otherwise targets the Hermit. If Blind Fury was triggered, uses EMBODIMENTS OF EVIL! instead.
ai.notes: This ally's Mass Attack deals a lot of damage to you, so it's important to share your Block so Blind Fury doesn't trigger too often! Additionally, if the Mass Attack kills the Hermit on the first or second hit, the rest of the attacks won't occur.

ai.desc: Uses Rage every turn. Targets the Hermit's Staff if it's alive, otherwise targets the Hermit. If Blind Fury was triggered, uses EMBODIMENTS OF EVIL! instead.

ai.desc: In Stage 3, the first 2 intents have equal chances of using Ram or Bite, but cannot use either move 3 times in a row. The 3rd intent will begin with Ram on the Corpse and alternate with Vomit on you. In Stage 2, the first intent has equal chances of using Devour, Bite, or Horrid Screech - Devour and Bite cannot be used twice in a row, and Horrid Screech cannot be used again until 2 turns have passed. The 2nd intent will use Devour on the Corpse. In Stage 1, its single intent will use Devour on the Corpse.
ai.notes: Stage 3 is its most dangerous form, so it's very important to quickly burst this creature down so it shrinks to Stage 2. In addition, be careful about killing the Corpse yourself since that will redirect this creature's attacks on the Corpse to you, which can result in you taking unnecessary damage.

ai.desc: On the first intent, cycles Ferocious Fangs -> Cruel Claws -> Bloodstained Hunt. On the 2nd intent, cycles Bloodstained Hunt -> Howl -> Ferocious Fangs. The first intent targets you, and the 2nd intent targets Little Red.
ai.notes: Try to control your damage output so that Little Red can land the killing blow on the Wolf!

ai.desc: Cycles Hollow Point Shell -> Catch Breath -> Beast Hunt. After enraging, begins with Bullet Shower then alternates with Hollow Point Shell.

ai.desc: On the first intent, begins with Shining Light then alternates with Dazzle. On the 2nd intent, begins with Dazzle, then uses Enchant on the left Sage and alternates with Shining Light. On the 3rd intent, begins with Enchant on the right Sage and alternates with Shining Light. If the left Sage is dead, the 2nd intent will use Illuminate alternating with Shining Light. If the right Sage is dead, the 3rd intent will use Brilliance alternating with Shining Light.
ai.notes: Make sure to keep your allies alive by playing Attacks on them when they get Enchanted!

ai.desc: Starts with Ring, then uses Smash every turn.
Cycles Rising Star -> Starry Sky -> Sound of a Star. If both Worshippers are dead, will temporarily deviate from the cycle to use Worshippers, then return back to where it was in the cycle.
ai.notes: Try to control your damage so the Worshippers will suicide on their turn instead of exploding on you!

ai.desc: Uses For the Star and Everlasting Faith with equal chances, but cannot use either move 3 times in a row. If HP is at or below 50%, will use Hear the Sound of the Star! every turn instead. If HP is at or below 25%, will immediately change intent to use We'll Meet Soon as Stars! instead.

ai.desc: Begins with Blizzard. Will use Blizzard again after the Prison of Ice dies. Otherwise, has equal chances of using Frigid Gaze, Ice Splinters, or Frozen Throne. Frigid Gaze and Ice Splinters cannot be used twice in a row, and Frozen Throne cannot be used again until at least 2 turns have passed. Can only use Frozen Throne a total of 2 times. After capping Frozen Throne usage, Frigid Gaze and Ice Splinters cannot be used 3 times in a row instead.
ai.notes: Try to Freeze low-cost cards and combo cards with Promise of Winter so that you can freely play them when you Unfreeze them or use the Freeze effect as a budget Retain effect to set up your combos.

ai.desc: Begins with a deck of 3 Protects and 3 Attacks. Draws and uses a card for each intent. After merging with the Hands, gains a new deck of 1 Flurry of Fists, 2 Giant Fist, 2 Compress, 1 Baleful Brand, and 1 Lock. If the left Hand was killed first, add an additional Baleful Brand. Otherwise, add an extra Lock. Uses Distorted Blade every 5 turns.
